metadata.title: CVE-2018-3693 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and branchprediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attackerwith local user access via a speculative buffer overflow and side-channelanalysis.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-112-generic - 4.4.0-112.135
linux-image-4.4.0-112-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-112.135
linux-image-4.4.0-112-lowlatency - 4.4.0-112.135
linux-image-4.4.0-112-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-112.135
linux-image-4.4.0-112-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-112.135
linux-image-4.4.0-112-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-112.135
linux-image-4.4.0-112-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-112.135
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-112-generic - 4.4.0-112.135
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1085-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1085.93
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1087-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1087.92
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1013-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1017-kvm - 4.4.0-1017.22
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-9023-euclid - 4.4.0-9023.24
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-9023-euclid - 4.4.0-9023.24
No subscription required

intel-microcode - 3.20180312.0~ubuntu16.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-112.135').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1085.93').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1087.92').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1049.58').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1017.22').
linux-euclid package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9023.24').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
intel-microcode package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20180312.0~ubuntu16.04.1').
firefox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1005.5').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
